title: Kim Ung-seo
text:
Kim Ung-so (1564–1624) was a senior military officer in the <a href="Joseon%20dynasty">Joseon dynasty</a>. During the <a href="Imjin%20war">Imjin war</a>, he was in charge of soldiers and horses in the Eastern <a href="Gyeongsang">Gyeongsang</a> Province.
During this war, he was ordered to proceed north with his troops and fight the <a href="Jurchen%20people">Jurchen</a>s instead of the Japanese. His army of 15,000 Koreans later joined the Chinese Commander Ma Gui and 24,000 Chinese soldiers in the <a href="Second%20Siege%20of%20Ulsan">Second Siege of Ulsan</a>; the combined force failed to take the Japanese Castle.
The <a href="Kim%20Ung-so%20House">house</a> where he was born in Okto-ri, <a href="Ryonggang%20County">Ryonggang County</a>, <a href="Nampo">Nampo</a> is considered one of the <a href="National%20Treasures%20of%20North%20Korea">National Treasures of North Korea</a>.
